titlestmt.subtitle: An inventory of his cartoons at Syracuse University

list.item: 5 Jan 2010 - added bio, scope and inventory (SK)

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract:
12 original editorial cartoons from the
Orlando Evening Star.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: Richard Hodgins, Sr. (1905-1984), commonly known as Dick Hodgins, Sr., was an American editorial cartoonist.

Richard “Dick” Hodgins, Sr. was born in Valley Falls, Rhode Island on July 13, 1905 and attended the Rhode Island School of Design. He spent thirteen years as the editorial cartoonist for the Orlando Sentinel Star until he retired to Cape Cod in 1970. The National Cartoonists Society awarded Hodgins the Silver T-Square award in 1971. Hodgins published two instructional books: The Great American Book of Cartooning (1979) and Drawing Animals (1979).
Richard Hodgins, Sr. died in August 1984. His son, Dick Hodgins, Jr. is an award-winning cartoonist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p:
The
Richard Hodgins, Sr. Cartoons contains 12 original editorial cartoons published by the
Orlando Evening Star. The cartoons are undated but are from approximately 1968. The cartoons were drawn with ink, crayon and color gauche on illustration board and are mounted. Traces of pencil are visible. Images measure 9 1/2" x 12" with the items measuring 13 1/2" x 16".

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: Cartoons are arranged alphabetically by caption.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: &scrc_name; has collections of over one hundred cartoonists. Please refer to &subjindex; for a complete listing.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The majority of our archival and manuscript collections are housed offsite and require advanced notice for retrieval. Researchers are encouraged to contact us in advance concerning the collection material they wish to access for their research.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Written permission must be obtained from SCRC and all relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any materials in this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

scopecontent.p:
'Bout Time For Cleaning: law and order
Chained For Life: gun control
Ev's Being Heard: Everett Dirksen, Abe Fortas
Getting A Slow Burn!: weather
Getting A Tighter Grip!: crime
Heading For The Oregon Trail: Robert F. Kennedy
Heavy, Heavy, What Hangs Over?: George Wallace
Heel Them Under: gun control
The Old Squeeze Play!: taxes; Orange County, Florida
Taking A Second Look At Miami: Democratic National Convention
They're Off And Running!: Orange County, Florida
Warning Signal: Florida, forest fires
